Package com.dselent.bigarraylist

Class BigArrayList<E extends Serializable>

java.lang.Object
com.dselent.bigarraylist.BigArrayList<E>
Type Parameters:
E - Generic type
public class BigArrayList<E extends Serializable> extends Object
A BigArrayList acts the same way a regular ArrayList would for data sizes that cannot fit in memory all at once. This class can be used like an ArrayList with limited functionality. All the file I/O operations are managed automatically and internally.

The size and number of cache blocks to be stored in memory can be specified.

BigArrayList uses an internal ArrayList of ArrayLists (A list of cache blocks) to map data in memory to disk. The mapping is managed and maintained by the CacheMapping class. The File I/O uses Object input/output streams for classes that implement the serializable interface. An LRU cache policy is used to determine which block of data so swap out of memory.

A BigArrayList currently supports adding elements to the end of the list and setting/getting elements

Example code is below: 

 
 //Construct an instance of BigArrayList with 4 cache blocks of size 100,000 each
 //to store data in a folder called "memory" relative to the programs starting file path location
 BigArrayList<Long> arrayList = new BigArrayList<Long>("memory", 100000, 4);
 
 //Add elements to the list
 for(long i=0; i<1000000; i++)
 {
     arrayList.add(i);
 }
 
 //Set and get elements
 arrayList.set(10, 100L);
 long getElement = arrayList.get(10);
 
 //Clear data from disk when done
 arrayList.clearMemory();

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    BigArrayList()
    Constructs a BigArrayList with default values for the number of cache blocks, size of each cache block, folder path, and serialization method.
    BigArrayList(int blockSize, int cacheBlocks)
    Constructs a BigArrayList with the specified block size and number of cache blocks to use.
    BigArrayList(int blockSize, int cacheBlocks, String folderPath)
    Constructs a BigArrayList with the size and number of cache blocks and the folder path to write to.
    BigArrayList(String folderPath)
    Constructs a BigArrayList with the specified folder path to use for swapping contents to and from disk.

  • Constructor Details

    • BigArrayList

      public BigArrayList()
      Constructs a BigArrayList with default values for the number of cache blocks, size of each cache block, folder path, and serialization method.

    • BigArrayList

      public BigArrayList(String folderPath)
      Constructs a BigArrayList with the specified folder path to use for swapping contents to and from disk.
      Default values are used for the number of cache blocks, size of each cache block, and serialization method.
      Parameters:
      folderPath - The file path to write to

    • BigArrayList

      public BigArrayList(int blockSize, int cacheBlocks)
      Constructs a BigArrayList with the specified block size and number of cache blocks to use.
      Default values are used for the folder path and serialization method.
      Parameters:
      blockSize - Size of each cache block
      cacheBlocks - Number of cache blocks stored in memory at a given time

    • BigArrayList

      public BigArrayList(int blockSize, int cacheBlocks, String folderPath)
      Constructs a BigArrayList with the size and number of cache blocks and the folder path to write to.
      Parameters:
      blockSize - cacheSize Size of each cache block
      cacheBlocks - Number of cache blocks stored in memory at a given time
      folderPath - The folder path to write to

    • sort

      public static <T extends Comparable<? super T> & Serializable> BigArrayList<T> sort(BigArrayList<T> unsortedList) throws IOException
      Sorts the BigArrayList. Note that the usage mimics Collections.sort() except that the sorted list is returned. The caller must set their list to equal the return value (similar to String concatenation), ex: sortedList = BigArrayList.sort(sortedList);
      Parameters:
      unsortedList - The list to be sorted
      Returns:
      The list in sorted order
      Throws:
      IOException

    • sort

      public static <T extends Serializable> BigArrayList<T> sort(BigArrayList<T> unsortedList, Comparator<? super T> comparator) throws IOException
      Sorts the BigArrayList. Note that the usage mimics Collections.sort() except that the sorted list is returned. The caller must set their list to equal the return value (similar to String concatenation), ex: sortedList = BigArrayList.sort(sortedList);
      Parameters:
      unsortedList - unsortedList The list to be sorted
      comparator - How to compare the elements in the list
      Returns:
      The list in sorted order
      Throws:
      IOException
